verses.verse: The oracle <S%H9294><s%> concerning Tyre. <S%H6865><s%> Wail, <S%H3213><s%> O ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish, <S%H8659><s%> For [Tyre] is destroyed, <S%H7703><s%> without <S%H4480><s%> house <S%H1004><s%> [or] harbor; <S%H935><s%> It is reported <S%H1540><s%> to them from the land <S%H776><s%> of Cyprus. <S%H3794><s%>

Be silent, <S%H1826><s%> you inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the coastland, <S%H339><s%> You merchants <S%H5503><s%> of Sidon; <S%H6721><s%> Your messengers <S%H4390><s%> crossed <S%H5674><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%>

And [were] on many <S%H7227><s%> waters. <S%H4325><s%> The grain <S%H2233><s%> of the Nile, <S%H7883><s%> the harvest <S%H7105><s%> of the River <S%H2975><s%> was her revenue; <S%H8393><s%> And she was the market <S%H5504><s%> of nations. <S%H1471><s%>

Be ashamed, <S%H954><s%> O Sidon; <S%H6721><s%> For the sea <S%H3220><s%> speaks, <S%H559><s%> the stronghold <S%H4581><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "I have neither <S%H3808><s%> travailed <S%H9123><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> given <S%H3205><s%> birth, <S%H3205><s%> I have neither <S%H3808><s%> brought <S%H1431><s%> up young <S%H970><s%> men <S%H970><s%> [nor] reared <S%H7311><s%> virgins. <S%H1330><s%>"
When <S%H9201><s%> the report <S%H8088><s%> [reaches] Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> They will be in anguish <S%H9123><s%> at the report <S%H8088><s%> of Tyre. <S%H6865><s%>
Pass <S%H5674><s%> over <S%H5674><s%> to Tarshish; <S%H8659><s%> Wail, <S%H3213><s%> O inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the coastland. <S%H339><s%>

Is this <S%H384><s%> your jubilant <S%H5947><s%> [city,] Whose origin <S%H6927><s%> is from antiquity, <S%H6927><s%> Whose feet <S%H7272><s%> used to carry <S%H2986><s%> her to colonize <S%H1481><s%> distant <S%H7350><s%> places?

Who <S%H4310><s%> has planned <S%H3289><s%> this <S%H384><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> the bestower <S%H5849><s%> of crowns, <S%H5849><s%> Whose <S%H834><s%> merchants <S%H5503><s%> were princes, <S%H8269><s%> whose traders <S%H9211><s%> were the honored <S%H3513><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>?

The Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> has planned <S%H3289><s%> it to defile <S%H2490><s%> the pride <S%H1347><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> beauty, <S%H9469><s%> To despise <S%H7043><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the honored <S%H3513><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>

Overflow <S%H5674><s%> your land <S%H776><s%> like the Nile, <S%H2975><s%> O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Tarshish, <S%H8659><s%> There <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> restraint. <S%H9253><s%>

He has stretched <S%H5186><s%> His hand <S%H3027><s%> out over <S%H5921><s%> the sea, <S%H3220><s%> He has made the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> tremble; <S%H7264><s%> The Lord <S%H3068><s%> has given <S%H6680><s%> a command <S%H6680><s%> concerning <S%H413><s%> Canaan <S%H3667><s%> to demolish <S%H8045><s%> its strongholds. <S%H4581><s%>

And He has said, <S%H559><s%> "You shall exult <S%H5937><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more, <S%H3254><s%> <S%H5750><s%> O crushed <S%H6231><s%> virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Sidon. <S%H6721><s%> Arise, <S%H6965><s%> pass <S%H5674><s%> over <S%H5674><s%> to Cyprus; <S%H3794><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> you will find <S%H5117><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> rest. <S%H5117><s%>"

Behold, <S%H2005><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%> – this <S%H2088><s%> is the people <S%H5971><s%> [which] was not; Assyria <S%H804><s%> appointed <S%H3245><s%> it for desert <S%H9478><s%> creatures <S%H9478><s%> – they erected <S%H6965><s%> their siege <S%H969><s%> towers, <S%H969><s%> they stripped <S%H6209><s%> its palaces, <S%H759><s%> they made <S%H7760><s%> it a ruin. <S%H9281><s%>
Wail, <S%H3213><s%> O ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish, <S%H8659><s%> For your stronghold <S%H4581><s%> is destroyed. <S%H7703><s%>

Now it will come <S%H1961><s%> about in that day <S%H3117><s%> that Tyre <S%H6865><s%> will be forgotten <S%H7911><s%> for seventy <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> like the days <S%H3117><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> king. <S%H4428><s%> At the end <S%H7093><s%> of seventy <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> it will happen <S%H1961><s%> to Tyre <S%H6865><s%> as [in] the song <S%H9598><s%> of the harlot: <S%H2181><s%>

Take <S%H3947><s%> [your] harp, <S%H3658><s%> walk <S%H5437><s%> about <S%H5437><s%> the city, <S%H5892><s%> O forgotten <S%H7911><s%> harlot; <S%H2181><s%> Pluck <S%H5059><s%> the strings <S%H5059><s%> skillfully, <S%H3190><s%> sing many <S%H7235><s%> songs, <S%H7892><s%> That you may be remembered. <S%H2142><s%>

And it will come <S%H1961><s%> about at the end <S%H7093><s%> of seventy <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> will visit <S%H6485><s%> Tyre. <S%H6865><s%> Then she will go <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> to her harlot <S%H2181><s%>'s wages, <S%H868><s%> and will play <S%H2181><s%> the harlot with all <S%H3605><s%> the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> on the face <S%H6440><s%> of the earth. <S%H127><s%>

And her gain <S%H5504><s%> and her harlot's wages <S%H868><s%> will be set <S%H6944><s%> apart <S%H6944><s%> to the Lord; <S%H3068><s%> it will not be stored <S%H686><s%> up or hoarded, <S%H2630><s%> but her gain <S%H5504><s%> will become <S%H1961><s%> sufficient <S%H7654><s%> food <S%H398><s%> and choice <S%H6266><s%> attire <S%H4374><s%> for those who dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>
